meanings.definition: Continuous rapid firing of artillery or machine guns.
meanings.sent1: The drumfire from the battlefield echoed through the night.
meanings.sent2: The drumfire of the cannons signaled the start of the battle.
meanings.sent3: The drumfire of popcorn popping in the microwave made everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: The drumfire of raindrops on the roof created a soothing lullaby.
meanings.sent5: The drumfire of applause filled the auditorium after the performance.

meanings.definition: A continuous or rapid series of loud, deep sounds.
meanings.sent1: The drumfire of thunder shook the windows.
meanings.sent2: The drumfire of fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The drumfire of footsteps approaching made her heart race.
meanings.sent4: The drumfire of engines revving signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent5: The drumfire of waves crashing against the shore was mesmerizing.
